item.title: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida to step down next month
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee, Julia Mio Inuma
item.description: Kishida said he will stand down as leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, and therefore as prime minister, to allow the party to recover from recent scandals.

item.title: A charity gave donated candy to families. It turned out to be meth.
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: New Zealand police are investigating the source of the candies, which were packed in Rinda-branded wrapping and had a potentially lethal concentration of meth.

item.title: As Vietnam tightens leash on criticism, scores are jailed and exiled
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan
item.description: The crackdown on human rights comes at a time when the United States is deepening security and economic ties with Hanoi.

item.title: Ukraine turns the tables on Russia
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: A bold Ukrainian operation in Kursk has humiliated Russian President Vladimir Putin and upended some of the logic of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: U.N. experts say Venezuela election results lack basic transparency
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt
item.description: A panel of four U.N. experts criticized Venezuela’s decision to announce an election outcome without offering a detailed breakdown of the vote.

item.title: U.S. plans to sell $20 billion in weapons to Israel over several years
item.dc:creator: Kyle Melnick, Karen DeYoung
item.description: The Biden administration approved a deal to sell F-15s, air-to-air missiles and munitions, but much of it won’t arrive in Israel until 2026 at the earliest.

item.title: Suspected Iranian hacks are latest round of U.S. election interference
item.dc:creator: Shane Harris, Ellen Nakashima, Josh Dawsey
item.description: National security officials and researchers noted a rise in “troublesome” Iranian influence operations designed to meddle in the U.S. presidential race.

item.title: Defense secretary’s intervention in 9/11 cases faces judge’s scrutiny
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: A judge overseeing the 9/11 cases against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and others will examine if it was legal for Lloyd Austin to rescind their plea agreements.

item.title: Ukraine says captured Russian soldiers could be part of prisoner exchange
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Robyn Dixon
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky and his top military commander claimed more gains in advance in Kursk.

item.title: Disease was spreading in Gaza. Now there’s polio in the sewage.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Hajar Harb
item.description: Israel’s war in Gaza has destroyed its water and sanitation infrastructure, leaving sewage in the streets as a breeding ground for infectious diseases.

item.title: In Australia, Raygun’s zero in Olympic breaking is a perfect score
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Frances Vinall
item.description: Rachael Gunn, aka Raygun, drew mockery for dance moves like the kangaroo paw. But that didn’t stop Aussies from cheering their Napoleon Vegemite for “having a go.”

item.title: Two bodies unearthed in ancient Pompeii with ‘small cache of treasure’
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: A new discovery at the ancient site of Pompeii has uncovered the remains of a man and a woman who perished while sheltering in a room, archaeologists said.

item.title: Two polar bears kill worker at remote Canadian radar site in rare attack
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset
item.description: Nasittuq Corp., which operates and maintains radar sites for Canada’s government, confirmed the death in last week’s polar bear attack on Brevoort Island, Nunavut.

item.title: How an Israeli hostage rescue that left scores of Palestinians dead unfolded
item.dc:creator: Imogen Piper, Evan Hill, Sarah Cahlan, Hajar Harb, Hazem Balousha, Miriam Berger, Loveday Morris
item.description: A review of videos of the June 8 raid in Nuseirat shows the Israeli military employed heavy airstrikes on a dense residential area for nearly four hours

item.title: Helicopter crashes into Hilton hotel, kills pilot in ‘unauthorized’ flight
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Police in Cairns, in Queensland, Australia, said the flight was “unauthorized” and are investigating. Two guests at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel were injured.

item.title: Bangladeshis applaud leader’s ouster but fear old guard will strike back
item.dc:creator: Karishma Mehrotra, Anant Gupta
item.description: The toppling of Sheikh Hasina by student protesters has sparked hope for dramatic changes but it’s tempered by concerns the revolution could be hijacked.

item.title: Israel anticipates direct attack from Iran; U.S. deploys more vessels to region
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Rachel Pannett, Dan Lamothe, Leo Sands, Lior Soroka, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: A U.S. Navy submarine and several destroyers have been sent as concerns grow in the region about a potential Iranian attack on Israel.

item.title: Mapping Ukraine’s incursion in Russia
item.dc:creator: Laris Karklis
item.description: Tracking Ukraine’s advance inside Russia with maps.

item.title: Russians evacuated from Kursk as Putin grapples with Ukrainian incursion
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The acting governor of the Kursk region said the situation is “complicated,” with Ukraine’s forces now in control of more than two dozen Russian villages.

item.title: Fearing war, unsettled at home, Iran weighs retaliation against Israel
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous, Mustafa Salim
item.description: Iran seeks to project a show of force while avoiding a regional war, a task that has become more difficult after its first direct attack on Israel, which occurred in April.

item.title: After far-right riots, Brits of color contemplate their safety
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Large counterprotests have pushed back on anti-immigrant riots. But for people of color and immigrant groups, the riots exposed a worrying undercurrent.

item.title: ‘Exceptionally dangerous’ wildfire with 80-foot flames rages around Athens
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Morgan Coates
item.description: Greek authorities ordered mass evacuations in more than a dozen areas, spanning several Athens suburbs, as the fire spread out of control.
